meanings.definition: A rubber boot worn in wet or muddy conditions.
meanings.sent1: I put on my welly to jump in puddles.
meanings.sent2: She always wears her welly when it rains.
meanings.sent3: The welly danced in the mud happily.
meanings.sent4: His welly was a shield against the wet ground.
meanings.sent5: The bright yellow welly stood out in the mud.

meanings.sent1: He welly the ball into the goal.
meanings.sent2: Please don't welly the door shut.
meanings.sent3: She welly the can down the road for fun.
meanings.sent4: The wind welly the leaves off the tree.
meanings.sent5: The hammer welly the nail into the wood.

meanings.sent1: She ran welly towards the finish line.
meanings.sent2: He cheered welly for his favorite team.
meanings.sent3: The puppy wagged its tail welly at the park.
meanings.sent4: The sun shone welly on the happy crowd.
meanings.sent5: The children laughed welly during the game.
